page.title: 04Gravel Extraction.
page.content: Gravel extraction is a major landscape influence in the section of the Ouse Valley on the western edge of the survey area.River terrace sand and gravel deposits of high quality are extracted for use in the road and house construction industry. The environmental impact of these quarries varies with the nature of the individual workings.At the present they are screened quite effectivly by trees and being "wet" will eventually flood. This means that when digging out is complete restoration will involve the production of a number of lagoons. These could be made avalible for leisure activities-fishing,water sports,birdwatching-and has happened in other parts of the county. Recent plans to extend these workings towards the village of Sharnbrook.
